menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Encrypted|1:Encrypted
41:Sensor Rest|42:Sensor Motion|11:Ignition Off Rest|12:Ignition On Motion|21:Ignition On Rest|22:Ignition On Motion|1A:Fake Tow|16:Tow|
0:Stop Charging|1:Charging
0:Unknow|1:Inserted|2:Removed|3:Ready|4:Locked Pin|5:Locked PUK|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|
0: No Searching|1: Registered|2: Searching|3: Denied|4: Unknown|5: Roaming|6: Only Local SMS|7: Only Roaming SMS|8: Registration of Emergency Services|
0: Deactivated|1: Activating|2: Activated|3: Deactivating|
0: Initial|1: No Service|2: Idle|3: Activating|4: Connecting|5: Sending|6: Reset|
0: Off|1: On|
0: GPGSV|1: GLGSV|2: BDGSV|

menu3.Description: [{"name":"SV ID1","value":"1"},{"name":"SV Power1","value":"40"}]

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|
Digital output 1|Digital output 2|
0: Read|1: Send|
0: Normal IO|1: Function IO|2: Interrupt IO|
0: Input|1: Output|
0: Low level|1: High Level|
0: Disable Pull|1: Enable Pull|
0: Pull Down|1: Pull Up|
0: Off|1: On|
0: BG22C224|1: BLUENRG345|

menu2.name: BSI (Bearer Setting Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBSI is used to configure the GPRS parameters

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Auto (LTE & GSM)|1: GSM Only|2: Reserved|3: LTE Only

menu2.name: SRI (Backend Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSRI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the communication method between the backend server and the terminal. When the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7:Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9: MQTT mode |
0: Disable|1: Low priority|2: High priority |
0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|

menu3.Description: 0: The device will send the ACK confirmation using the mode specified by <Report Mode>|1: The device will send the ACK confirmation via SMS to the phone number from which the command is sent via SMS|

menu2.name: QSS (Quick Start Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTQSS is used to configure the GPRS parameters and backend server information if the length of all the settings is no greater than 160 bytes. Otherwise, the two commands AT+GTBSI and AT+GTSRI are used to configure those settings.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Stop mode|1: TCP short-connection preferred mode|2: TCP short-connection forced mode|3: TCP long-connection mode|4: UDP mode|5: Forced SMS mode|6: UDP with fixed local port mode|7: Backup server supported TCP long-connection mode|9:MQTT mode|
0: Disable|1: Low priority |2: High priority|
0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|

menu3.Description: 0: The device will send the ACK confirmation using the mode specified by <Report Mode>|1: The device will send the ACK confirmation via SMS to the phone number from which the command is sent via SMS|

menu2.name: MQT ( MQTT Server Connection Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMQT is used to configure the username and password to connect to the MQTT server and to subscribe to topics and publish topics, If the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the MQTT server.

menu2.name: MSI (Multi Server Registration Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMSI is used to configure where and how to report all the messages, including the server information and the communication method between the backend server and the terminal. When the terminal is configured correctly, it should be able to report data to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 2:The Data Server of MSI
0:Stop mode.|2:TCP short-connection forced mode.|3:TCP long-connection mode.|4:UDP mode. |6:UDP with fixed local port.|
0:Disable|1:Enable SACK And Check|2:Enable SACK But Not check|

menu2.name: TLS (TLS Data Encryption)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTLS is used to configure TLS encryption parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Data Server of SRI|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Do not verify the certificates|1: Only server certification|2: Two-way certification|
menu3.Description: 0: In this method, no certificates need to be built into the terminal.|1: In this method, at least the CA file needs to be built into the terminal.|2: In this method, at least the CA file, Client Certificate file, Client key file need to be built into the terminal.

menu2.name: OWL (Operator List)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWL is used to configure a white or forbidden list of operators to allow GPRS connection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: White list Mode|2: Black List Mode|

menu2.name: CFG (Global Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCFG command is used to configure global parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the odograph by GNSS|
Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Mileage|Send Time|Device Name|
0: Disable|1: GNSS Deep Saving Mode|2: GNSS Low Saving Mode|
The number of satellites in view for the current position (GNSS satellite number)|Reserved for indicating <GNSS Trigger Type> (in +RESP:GTFRI and +RESP:GTERI) report which can’t be set here|

menu3.Description: Reserved|PIN7. Set it to 0 to configure as analog input 1 and set to 1 as digital input 2|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|2: All LEDs will work 10 minutes after the device is powered on and then will be off|
menu3.Description: 0: Each time the device powers on, all LEDs will work for 30 minutes and then be off|1: All LEDs will be turned on as configured|2: All LEDs will work 10 minutes after the device is powered on and then will be off|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

0: Ignore SMS location request.|1: Report the current location(+RESP:GTLBC) to server.|2: Send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|&0: Hang up only.|1: Hang up and report the current location (+RESP:GTLBC) to server.|2: Hang up the call and send current location with Google map link to Caller ID via SMS.|3: Both 1 And 2|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Charge On Need|1: Charge After Ignition On|
menu3.Description: 0: When the main power supply is connected, the backup battery is charged as needed.|1: When the main power supply is connected, the backup battery is only charged when ignition on is detected. The charge process will begin 3 minutes after the ignition is turned on and stop when the ignition is turned off. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: AGPS Offline|2: AGPS Online|

00: Do not allow the cell information report.|40: Allow the cell information report after failing to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|80: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM after getting GNSS position successfully every time if cell information is available.|C0: Report the message +RESP:GTGSM no matter whether it is successful to get GNSS position if cell information is available.|&+RESP:GTRTL|+RESP:GTLBC|+RESP:GTFRI / +RESP:GTERI|+RESP:GTSOS|+RESP:GTTOW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|
0: GPS and GLONASS|1: GPS|4: GPS and BeiDou|
menu3.Description: 0: GPS and GLONASS positioning systems. In this mode, the device fixes position(s) with GPS and GLONASS systems. Note: If the current GNSS chip doesn’t support GPS and GLONASS combination mode, the device will get position by GPS only.| 1: GPS positioning system. In this mode, the device fixes position(s) only with GPS system.|4: GPS and BeiDou positioning systems. In this mode, the device fixes position(s) with GPS and BeiDou systems. Note: If the current GNSS chip doesn’t support GPS and BeiDou combination mode, the device will get position by GPS only.|

menu2.name: DOG (Protocol Watchdog)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOG command is used to reboot the device in a time based manner or upon ignition. This helps the device avoid working in an abnormal state for a long time. Besides these two automatic reboot methods, the device also supports the use of the digital input to trigger the reboot manually.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Reboot Periodically| 2: Ignition Reboot|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Reboot device|1: Reboot RF-Radio Frequency, only valid for <No Network Interval>, <No Activation Interval> and <Send Failure Timeout>|

menu2.name: GAM (GNSS-Assisted Motion Measurement)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGAM is used for assisting in measuring motion with GNSS if the sensor detects stationary state while the vehicle is ignition on.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: HMC (Hour Meter Count)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHMC is used to measure the accumulated use time with each actuation of the ignition on. To use this command, it is necessary to connect the ignition signal to the device or enable virtual ignition detection. When the device sends the +RESP:GTFRI, +RESP:GTIGN or +RESP:GTIGF message, <Hour Meter Count> will be included in these reports.

menu3.Description: 0: Disable the hour meter count function.|1: Enable the hour meter count function. The current <Hour Meter Count> reported in +RESP:GTFRI, +RESP:GTIGN and +RESP:GTIGF is equal to (=) <Hour Meter Count> + current <Initial Hour Meter Count> - last <Initial Hour Meter Count>.|

menu2.name: HRM (Hex Report Mask)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTHRM command consists of <+ACK Mask>, <+RSP Mask>, <+EVT Mask>, <+INF Mask>, <+HBD Mask> and <+CRD Mask> which control the composition of a HEX report message. In each HEX report message, the corresponding mask for the report indicates which part is reported.

menu3.RangeMx: Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|

Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|Reserved|CAN Data|

|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Battery Level|External Power Voltage|Analog Input Mode|Analog Input1 Voltage|Reserved|Reserved|Digital IO Status|Motion Status|Satellite Information|Current Mileage|Total Mileage|Current Hour Meter Count|Total Hour Meter Count|Reserved|CAN Data|

|Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number|INF Expansion Mask|+RESP:GTVER|+RESP:GTIOS|+RESP:GTGPS|+RESP:GTBAT|+RESP:GTCID|+RESP:GTCSQ|+RESP:GTTMZ|+RESP:GTGSM
Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTCVN|+RESP:GTCSN|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTCML|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTBTI|Reserved|Reserved|+RESP:GTSCS|Reserved|Reserved|INF Expansion2 Mask|
Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Network Type|
|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Device Name|Send Time|Count Number|UID
|Length|Device Name|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version|Send Time|Count Number
|Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells Information|Send Time|Count Number|Device Name|Length|Device Type|Protocol Version|Firmware Version

menu2.name: OWH (Outside Working Hours)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOWH is used to define the working hours and the working mode to protect the privacy.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Manual Mode|2: Full Manual Mode|3: Automatic Mode|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Manual mode. By connecting an external unit to a specified digital input of the device, the driver manually enables time check.|2: Full manual mode. By connecting an external unit to a specified digital input of the device, the driver has full control of the privacy protection.|3: Automatic mode. In this mode, the device will ignore the status of the digital input. It will automatically check the current time against the working hours range.|

menu2.name: PDS (Settings for Preserving Device’s Specified Logic States)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPDS is used to preserve specified logic states of the device. The specified logic states selected based on the value of component mask will be preserved or reset according to the setting of <Mode>.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Save Logical States|2: Reset Logical States|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Preserve specified logic state(s) of the device according to the value of <Mask>.| 2: Reset all the specified logic states listed in <Mask> after receiving the command, and then preserve the specified logic states according to the value of <Mask>.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: State of GEO|1: Reserved|2: Reserved|3: Information of last known position|4: State of ignition|5: State of wave shape 1|6: State of digital input|7: State of SPD|8: State of SSR|9: State of main power|10: State of PEO|

menu2.name: PIN (Auto-unlock PIN)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPIN is used to configure the auto-unlock PIN function of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: TMA (Time Adjustment)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTMA is used to adjust for the local time of the device remotely. Upon receiving this command, the device will set the time zone and daylight saving accordingly. Then it will use the given UTC time to adjust for the local time based on the time zone and daylight saving setting.

menu2.name: WLT (White List)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTWLT is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to perform the SMS functions.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit0: White list for location by call.|Bit1: Reserved.|Bit2: White list for SMS.|
menu3.Description: Bit0: White list for location by call.|Bit1: Reserved.|Bit2: White list for SMS. Gateway number and SOS number will ignore the white list function.|

menu2.name: AVS (Accelerometer (Motion Status)Virtual Ignition Settings)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAVS is used to configure parameters for detecting virtual ignition status based on motion status. It works when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Accelerometer (motion status) virtual ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu2.name: VVS (Voltage Virtual Ignition Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVVS is used to configure parameters for checking ignition state by voltage. It will work when hard-wired ignition line is not connected and Voltage Virtual Ignition mode is enabled by AT+GTVMS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the smart voltage adjustment algorithm. The values of <Ignition On Voltage> and <Voltage Offset> will keep static.|1: Enable the smart voltage adjustment algorithm. The values of <Ignition On Voltage> and <Voltage Offset> will dynamically change according to the actual ignition on and off voltage.|

menu2.name: VMS (Virtual Ignition Mode Selection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTVMS is used to configure the mode of virtual ignition state detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Voltage virtual ignition detection mode. |4: Accelerometer virtual ignition detection mode|7: Combined detection mode. |
Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
Bit0 (01): Voltage virtual ignition detection|Bit1 (02): Motion status virtual ignition detection|
0:AND logic.|1:OR logic.|

menu2.name: CMD (Command String Storage)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCMD command is used to store the commands which will be used by the command AT+GTUDF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete command.|1: Add command.|

menu2.name: UDF (User Defined Function)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUDF command is used to bind input events and stored commands. The input events will trigger the corresponding stored commands.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable The Event Group.|1: Enable The Event Group|2: Delete The Event Group|

Power on finished|Ignition on|Ignition off|Attached to the GPRS network|Not attached to the GPRS network|Registered on GSM network|Not registered on GSM network|Network roaming|Network non-roaming|Reserved|GNSS is on|GNSS is off|The device is stationary|The device is moving|External charge inserted|No external charge|The device is charging|The device is not charging|Digital input 2 is inactive|Digital input 2 is active|Digital input 1 is inactive|Digital input 1 is active|SIM card is inserted|SIM card is not inserted|Reserved|Reserved|Inside the speed range|Outside the speed range|Messages need to be sent|No messages need to be sent|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Network jamming is detected|Network jamming is not detected|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Driver authorized|Driver unauthorized|Reserved|Reserved|The device fixes GNSS successfully|The device fails to fix GNSS|

Inside the Geo 0|Inside the Geo 1|Inside the Geo 2|Inside the Geo 3|Inside the Geo 4|Inside the Geo 5|Inside the Geo 6|Inside the Geo 7|Inside the Geo 8|Inside the Geo 9|Inside the Geo 10|Inside the Geo 11|Inside the Geo 12|Inside the Geo 13|Inside the Geo 14|Inside the Geo 15|Inside the Geo 16|Inside the Geo 17|Inside the Geo 18|Inside the Geo 19|

Outside the Geo 0|Outside the Geo 1|Outside the Geo 2|Outside the Geo 3|Outside the Geo 4|Outside the Geo 5|Outside the Geo 6|Outside the Geo 7|Outside the Geo 8|Outside the Geo 9|Outside the Geo 10|Outside the Geo 11|Outside the Geo 12|Outside the Geo 13|Outside the Geo 14|Outside the Geo 15|Outside the Geo 16|Outside the Geo 17|Outside the Geo 18|Outside the Geo 19|

Stocmd ID Mask 0|Stocmd ID Mask 1|Stocmd ID Mask 2|Stocmd ID Mask 3|Stocmd ID Mask 4|Stocmd ID Mask 5|Stocmd ID Mask 6|Stocmd ID Mask 7|Stocmd ID Mask 8|Stocmd ID Mask 9|Stocmd ID Mask 10|Stocmd ID Mask 11|Stocmd ID Mask 12|Stocmd ID Mask 13|Stocmd ID Mask 14|Stocmd ID Mask 15|Stocmd ID Mask 16|Stocmd ID Mask 17|Stocmd ID Mask 18|Stocmd ID Mask 19|Stocmd ID Mask 20|Stocmd ID Mask 21|Stocmd ID Mask 22|Stocmd ID Mask 23|Stocmd ID Mask 24|Stocmd ID Mask 25|Stocmd ID Mask 26|Stocmd ID Mask 27|Stocmd ID Mask 28|Stocmd ID Mask 29|Stocmd ID Mask 30|Stocmd ID Mask 31|
menu3.Description: Note: The maximum number of the stored commands to be excuted in a group is five

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not send an acknowledgement message when a stored command is executed.|1: Send an acknowledgement message when a stored command is executed.|

menu3.RangeMx: Inside the Peo 0|Inside the Peo 1|Inside the Peo 2|Inside the Peo 3|Inside the Peo 4|Inside the Peo 5|Inside the Peo 6|Inside the Peo 7|Inside the Peo 8|Inside the Peo 9|Inside the Peo 10|Inside the Peo 11|Inside the Peo 12|Inside the Peo 13|Inside the Peo 14|Inside the Peo 15|Inside the Peo 16|Inside the Peo 17|Inside the Peo 18|Inside the Peo 19|

Outside the Peo 0|Outside the Peo 1|Outside the Peo 2|Outside the Peo 3|Outside the Peo 4|Outside the Peo 5|Outside the Peo 6|Outside the Peo 7|Outside the Peo 8|Outside the Peo 9|Outside the Peo 10|Outside the Peo 11|Outside the Peo 12|Outside the Peo 13|Outside the Peo 14|Outside the Peo 15|Outside the Peo 16|Outside the Peo 17|Outside the Peo 18|Outside the Peo 19|

WMS301 Index 0 Closed|WMS301 Index 1 Closed|WMS301 Index 2 Closed|WMS301 Index 3 Closed|WMS301 Index 4 Closed|WMS301 Index 5 Closed|WMS301 Index 6 Closed|WMS301 Index 7 Closed|WMS301 Index 8 Closed|WMS301 Index 9 Closed|

WMS301 Index 0 Separation|WMS301 Index 1 Separation|WMS301 Index 2 Separation|WMS301 Index 3 Separation|WMS301 Index 4 Separation|WMS301 Index 5 Separation|WMS301 Index 6 Separation|WMS301 Index 7 Separation|WMS301 Index 8 Separation|WMS301 Index 9 Separation|

menu2.name: BTS (Bluetooth Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBTS is used to configure Bluetooth settings for the device to report certain events.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General Discoverable After Igintion On|2:General Discoverable After Igintion Off|3:General Discoverable After Power On|
menu3.Description: 0: Non-discoverable mode|1: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after the ignition is turned on|2: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after the ignition is turned off|3: General discoverable mode: The device will remain discoverable for <Discoverable Time> minutes after it is powered on|

menu3.RangeMx: Bluetooth Name|Bluetooth MAC Address|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Peer Role|Reserved|Peer Address Type|Peer MAC Address|Peer Name|
0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: BAS (Bluetooth Accessory Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBAS is used for the device to scan or connect with Bluetooth accessories in order to obtain data such as humidity, temperature or fuel level. To use this command, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be enabled.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No Bluetooth accessory|1: Escort Bluetooth Accessory|2: Beacon temperature sensor|4: CAN accessory|6: Beacon Multi-Functional Sensorr|7: Technoton accessory|8: External Input Output Bluetooth Accessory|10: Mechatronics Bluetooth accessory|11: Magnet Bluetooth accessory|12: BLE TPMS sensor|13: Relay Bluetooth accessory|14: Smart Cap Bluetooth accessory|

Accessory Name|Accessory MAC|Accessory Status|Accessory Battery Level|Accessory Temperature|Accessory Humidity|Reserved|Accessory Input Output Data|Accessory Event Notification Data|Tire pressure|Time stamp|Enhanced Temperature|Magnet Data|Accessory Battery Percentage|Relay Data|
0: Disable event notification.|1: Enable event notification.|

0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters or exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters or exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report humidity alarm within the humidity range.|2: Report humidity alarm outside the humidity range.|3: Report humidity alarm only once enters or exits the humidity range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable humidity alarm.|1: Report humidity alarm if the current humidity is within the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>.|2: Report humidity alarm if the current humidity is outside the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>.|3: Report humidity alarm only once if the current humidity enters or exits the humidity range defined by <Low Humidity> and <High Humidity>. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The original value of fuel level.|1: The percentage of fuel level.|
0: Disable.|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable mag event notification.|1: Enable mag event notification. If a new event occurs on the accessory, the device will report the message +RESP:GTBAA.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report tire pressure alarm within the tire pressure range.|2: Report tire pressure alarm outside the tire pressure range.|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once enters/exits the tire pressure range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable tire pressure alarm.|1: Report tire pressure alarm if the current tire pressure is within the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>.|2: Report tire pressure alarm if the current tire pressure is outside the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>.|3: Report tire pressure alarm only once if the current tire pressure enters/exits the tire pressure range defined by <Low Tire Pressure> and <High Tire Pressure>. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

0: Disable|1: Report temperature alarm within the temperature range.|2: Report temperature alarm outside the temperature range .|3: Report temperature alarm only once enters or exits the temperature range. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters or exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.In this mode, <Temperature Send Interval> will be ignored.|

menu2.name: BID (Bluetooth Beacon ID Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTBID is used for the device to scan Bluetooth beacon accessories. To use this function, the parameter <Mode> in the command AT+GTBTS must be 1.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: WKF300|1: iBeacon E6|2: ID ELA|4: WID310|
Reserved|Accessory MAC|Reserved|Accessory Battery Level, iBeacon E6 is not supported|Reserved|Reserved|Signal Strength|Beacon Type and Beacon Data|
0:No push the WKF300|1:Push the WKF300|
0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once. |2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning Keyfobs continuously.|4: Allow the device to scan continuously.|
0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.|2: Allow the device to scan continuously. |
0: Disable alarm.|1: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast.|2: Alarm when Bluetooth broadcast is not received.|3: Alarm when receiving Bluetooth broadcast or leaving Bluetooth broadcast.|
0: Disable.|1: Allow the device to scan only once.|2: After entering ignition on and moving state, the device will keep scanning IDELA continuously.|3: Allow the device to scan continuously.|
0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Allow the device to scan continuously. |
menu3.Description: 0: Disable.|2: After entering ignition-on-and-moving state, the device will keep scanning WID310 continuously. |3: Enable detection: Allow the device to scan continuously. The +RESP:GTBID message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <WID310 IGN Report Interval>/<WID310 IGF Report Interval>. |

menu2.name: AEX (Analog Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAEX is used to configure the parameters of External Bluetooth Analog Input accessories. All these inputs are customizable.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Bluetooth Analog Input accessory setting|
0: Disable|1: Enable Analog Input Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Analog Input Alarm Outside The Range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Enable analog input alarm: If the current input voltage is within the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable analog input alarm: If the current input voltage is outside the range of (<Min. Threshold>, <Max. Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|

menu2.name: SVR (Primary Stolen Vehicle Recovery)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSVR is used to configure the Bluetooth settings for the Primary device. If the Primary device does not successfully communicate with the Ghost device within the time defined by <Connect Interval> * <Connect Fail Count>, it will report the message +RESP:GTSVR to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu2.name: FRI (Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFRI is used to configure the parameters for fixed report FRI or ERI.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Fixed Time Report.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Fixed Time Report. The position report message is sent to the backend server periodically according to the parameter <Send Interval>.|2: Fixed Distance Report. |3: Fixed Mileage Report. |4: Optimum Report. The device simultaneously checks both time interval and path length between two adjacent position reports.|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report. It checks either time interval or path length between two adjacent reports.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Enable report.|1:Disable report.
Reserved|1-Wire Data|CAN Data|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Bluetooth Accessory Data|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|RAT and Band Data|
0: Do not wrap corner point|1: Wrap corner point and wait|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not wrap corner point and send the corner point immediately when it is obtained.|1: Wrap corner point and wait until the condition to send +RESP:GTFRI or +RESP:GTERI is reached according to the setting of <Mode>|

menu2.name: FFC (Frequency Change of Fixed Report Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFFC is used to change the parameters of fixed report when a certain event occurs, so that different report interval requirements can be met. When the event disappears, the device will resume its previous settings.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Change FRI parameters By Geo-Fence Alarm|2: Change FRI parameters By Know Roaming Alarm|3: Change FRI parameters By Unknow Roaming Alarm|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the parameters of the specified priority|1: Change the fixed report parameter when the device enters into any of the defined Geo-Fence|2: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into known GSM roaming state|3: Change the fixed report parameters when the device enters into unknown GSM roaming state|

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable|1: Fixed Time Report|2: Fixed Distance Report|3: Fixed Mileage Report|4: Optimum Report|5: Fixed Time or Mileage Report|
menu3.Description: 0: Do not change the working mode|1: Change the working mode to “Fixed Time Report”|2: Change the working mode to “Fixed Distance Report”|3: Change the working mode to “Fixed Mileage Report”|4: Change the working mode to “Optimum Report”|5: Change the working mode to “Fixed Time or Mileage Report”|

menu2.name: ASC (Three Axis Self-Calibration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTASC is used to define the condition for calibrating the directions of accelerometer. When the auto self-calibration factors updated, the device will report the event message +RESP:GTASC which includes the calibration result to the backend server.

menu2.name: CRA (Crash Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCRA is used to configure the parameters for crash detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Detection Of Crash With Three-Axis|2: Enable Detection Of Crash With Self-calibration Three-Axis|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: In this mode, three-axis self-calibration is not needed.|2: In this mode, the acceleration sensor data will be converted in accordance with three-axis self-calibration (Please refer to AT+GTASC for detailed information). |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Start Sampling After power on|1: Start Sampling After ignition on|

menu2.name: BZA (Buzzer Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set buzzer alarm. There are four kinds of alarms. Each alarm outputs a different sound with the buzzer, and all the alarms are settable in this command. Before those alarms are used, the output ID which connects with the buzzer should be configured and enabled.

menu2.name: GEO (Geo-Fence Information)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTGEO is used to configure the parameters of circular Geo-Fence. Circular Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated. .

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the zone’s circular Geo-Fence function.|1: Entering the zone. The device will send the report +RESP:GTGIN to the server when it detects that vehicle enters the Geo-Fence area.|2: Exiting the zone. The device will send the report +RESP:GTGOT to the server when it detects that vehicle exits the Geo-Fence area.|3: Report the +RESP:GTGIN and +RESP:GTGOT when entering and exiting the Geo-Fence zone respectively.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|21: Auto Mode|22: Manual Mode|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable auto trigger mode.|21: Auto parking fence. Automatically set up Geo-Fence after ignition off. |22: Manual parking fence. Manually enable Geo-Fence after ignition off. |

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Ignore State Change|1: Need State Change|

menu2.name: PEO (Polygon Geo-Fence)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTPEO is used to configure the parameters of Polygon Geo-Fence. Geo-Fence is a virtual perimeter around a geographic area using a location-based service. When the geo-fencing terminal enters or exits the area, a notification is generated.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Entering the zone|2: Exiting the zone|3: Both entering and exiting|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the zone’s Geo-Fence function.|1: Entering the zone. The +RESP:GTGIN message will be generated only when the terminal enters the Geo-Fence.|2: Exiting the zone. The +RESP:GTGOT message will be generated only when the terminal exits from the Geo-Fence.|3: Report the +RESP:GTGIN and +RESP:GTGOT when entering and exiting the Geo-Fence zone respectively.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Report when getting the PEO state for the first time.|1: Do not report until the PEO state changes.

menu2.name: HBM (Harsh Behavior Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTHBM is used to monitor the harsh driving behavior based on GNSS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Detected by GNSS only|2: Detected by motion sensor only|3: Detected by motion sensor or GNSS|4: Detected by motion sensor and GNSS|5: Detected by XYZ-axis acceleration data only|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable this function.|1: Enable this function: Detection by GNSS only.|2: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor only.|3: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor or GNSS.|4: Enable this function: Detection by motion sensor and GNSS.|5: Enable this function: Detection by XYZ-axis acceleration data only.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Not Discard Unknow Alarm|1: Discard Unknow Alarm|
0: Only Report HBM Alarm|1: Report HBE and HBM Alarm|2: Only Report HBE Alarm|

menu2.name: IDL (Excessive Idling Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDL is used to detect the engine excessive idling (vehicle stays stationary while ignition is on). To use this command, the ignition signal must be connected to the device. If the vehicle is entering into/leaves the idle status, the device will report the event message IDN/IDF to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: JDC (Jamming Detection)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTJDC is used to configure the parameters for jamming detection. When the detection condition is matched, the device will report the event message JDR/JDS to the backend server according to the <Mode> setting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Report the alarm message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Report the alarm message upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable jamming detection function.|1: Enable jamming detection function. If jamming is detected, the device will report the +RESP:GTJDR message upon entering into jamming state.|2: Enable jamming detection function. If jamming is detected, the device will report the +RESP:GTJDS message upon entering into jamming state or quitting jamming state.|

menu2.name: RMD (Roaming Detection Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRMD is used to configure the parameters for GSM roaming detection.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: SOS (SOS Setting)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure a specified input port for emergency. When an emergency occurs, the end user can use the specified input port to trigger the emergency call and report the position message SOS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|2: Send the current position to the backend server only|4: Send the current position to the SMS gateway via SMS|
1: Send The Current GNSS Location|2: Send The Last GNSS Location|3: Both Mode 1 And 2|

menu2.name: SPA (Overspeed Alarm with Buzzer Notification)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set the speed thresholds and bind one alarm type with each speed threshold for the buzzer alarm. If the current speed meets one of the thresholds, the buzzer will make a sound corresponding to the alarm type.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Strict Standard Mode|2: Warning mode|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable|1: Strict standard mode. In this mode, the device will check the speed and trigger the buzzer alarm during speedup or slow down process.|2: Warning mode. In this mode, the device will only check the speed and trigger the buzzer alarm during the acceleration process..|

menu2.name: SPD (Speed Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a speed range for the speed alarm function of the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal could report the message SPD to the backend server when its moving speed is outside or inside the range.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Alarm in speed range|2: Alarm out of speed range|3: Report Speed Alarm Only once if the current speed enters or exits the speed range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable speed alarm|1: Report speed alarm if the current speed within the speed range specified by <Min Speed> and <Max Speed>|2: Report speed alarm if the current speed outside the speed range specified by <Min Speed> and <Max Speed>|3: Report speed alarm only once if the current speed is within/outside the speed range specified by <Min Speed> and <Max Speed>.In this mode, <Send Interval> will be ignored.| |

menu2.name: SSR (Start/Stop Report)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSSR is used to detect the status of vehicle (Start/Stop status). When it is detected by the device that the vehicle is entering into Start/Stop status, the device will report the event message STR/STP to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Minute|1: Second|

menu2.name: Tow (Tow Alarm Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTTOW command is used to configure the tow alarm parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: HUM (Humidity Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a humidity-alarm range for the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal will report the event message +RESP:GTHUM to the backend server when the humidity outside or inside the range is detected by the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the Alarm within the humidity range|2: Enable the Alarm Outside the humidity range|3: Enable the Alarm within or outside the humidity range, But Report only once|

menu2.name: AIS (Analog Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTAIS is used to configure the parameters of analog input ports.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable Alarm Within The Range|2: Enable Alarm Outside The Range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable analog input alarm.|1: Enable analog input alarm. If the current input voltage enters the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable analog input alarm. If the current input voltage exits the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the alarm will be triggered.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

menu2.name: DIS (Digital Input Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDIS is used to configure the parameters of 3 digital input ports. The input <Ignition Detection> is dedicated to ignition detection. The other two inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of the two digital input ports, the device will report the message DIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:The ID of the ignition detection port|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0:Send Real Time Position|1: Send Last Know Position|
menu3.Description: 0: Include real time position in the report +RESP:GTDIS. It takes a period of time to get GNSS position before the report.|1:Include the last known position in the report +RESP:GTDIS. The report can be sent to the backend server immediately after digital input state changes.|

menu2.name: DOS (Digital Output Port Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTDOS command is used to output specified wave shape from the digital output ports. A total of four wave shapes are supported as shown below. If set to wave shape 1, the device will maintain this wave shape at the specified output port after power reset.

menu3.Description: 0:A numerical to indicate the version of this command.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|
0: Disable status.|1: Enable status|2: Gradual-progressive-wave-shape Enable status|
For output 1 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 2 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|

menu2.name: EPS (External Power Supply Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTEPS is used to configure the parameters of external power supply monitoring. The device will measure and monitor the voltage of the external power supply. If the voltage of the external power supply matches the predefined alarm condition, the device will report an alarm message +RESP:GTEPS to the backend server to notify the status of the external power supply.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable |1: Report when the input voltage in the range|2: Report when the input voltage outside the range|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable the external power supply monitoring function.|1: Enable the external power supply monitoring function. If the current voltage is within the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.|2: Enable the external power supply monitoring function. If the current voltage is outside the range of (<Min Threshold>, <Max Threshold>), the +RESP:GTEPS alarm will be triggered.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not report external power supply voltage|1: Report external power supply voltage|

menu2.name: GDO (Gradual Digital Output Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTGDO command is used to configure specified gradual progressive wave shape from the digital output ports.

menu2.name: IOB (Input/Output Port Binding)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to configure the user defined output port actions triggered by input port. If the I/O binding is configured and the corresponding condition is met, the device will output specified wave shape on the specified output port.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|
Ignition detection|Digital input 1|Digital input 2|

menu2.name: CAN (CANBUS Device Configuration)
menu2.Description2: This command AT+GTCAN is used to set the CANBUS device configuration for reporting CANBUS device information.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|

VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nd|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information / Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Engine Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|CAN Report Expansion Mask|GNSS Information|GSM Information|
By ignition on/off event|

Ad-Blue Level|Axle Weight 1st|Axle Weight 3rd|Axle Weight 4th|Tachograph Overspeed Signal|Tachograph Vehicle Motion Signal|Tachograph Driving Direction|Analog Input Value|Engine Braking Factor|Pedal Braking Factor|Total Accelerator Kick-downs|Total Effective Engine Speed Time|Total Cruise Control Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Total Brake Applications|Tachograph Driver 1 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 2 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 1 Name|Tachograph Driver 2 Name|Registration Number|Expansion Information|Rapid Brakings|Rapid Accelerations|Engine Torque|
0: Disable this function.|1: Enable this function.|

menu2.name: CLT (CANBUS Alarm Setting)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTCLT command is used to set alarm threshold of CANBUS data.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the CAN alarm function.|1: Enable the CAN alarm function.|

VIN|Ignition Key|Total Distance|Total Fuel Used|Vehicle Speed|Engine RPM|Engine Coolant Temperature|Fuel Consumption|Fuel Level|Range|Accelerator Pedal Pressure|Total Engine Hours|Total Driving Time|Total Engine Idle Time|Total Idle Fuel Used|Axle Weight 2nd|Tachograph Information|Detailed Information/Indicators|Lights|Doors|Total Vehicle Overspeed Time|Total Vehicle Engine Overspeed Time|Total Distance Impulses|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|CAN Report Expansion Mask|

FL – fuel low indicator |DS – driver seatbelt indicator|AC – air conditioning|CC – cruise control |B – brake pedal |C – clutch pedal |H – handbrake|CL – central lock|R – reverse gear|RL – running lights|LB – low beams |HB – high beams |RFL – rear fog lights |FFL – front fog lights |D – doors |T – trunk |W – webcast |BFL – brake fluid low indicator |CLL – coolant level low indicator |BAT– battery indicator|BF – brake system failure indicator|OP – oil pressure indicator|EH – engine hot indicator|ABS – ABS failure indicator|Reserved|CHK –“check engine” indicator|AIR – airbags indicator|SC – service call indicator|OLL – oil level low indicator|

Running Lights|Low Beam|High Beam|Front Fog Light|Rear Fog Light |Hazard Lights|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Driver Door|Passenger Door |Rear Left Door |Rear Right Door|Trunk |Hood|

Under Low RPM Event |Over Low RPM Event |Under High RPM Event |Over High RPM Event |Under Vehicle Speed Low Threshold Event |Over Vehicle Speed Low Threshold Event |Under Vehicle Speed High Threshold Event |Over Vehicle Speed High Threshold Event|

Ad-Blue Level|Axle Weight 1st|Axle Weight 3rd|Axle Weight 4th|Tachograph Overspeed Signal|Tachograph Vehicle Motion Signal|Tachograph Driving Direction|Analog Input Value|Engine Braking Factor|Pedal Braking Factor|Total Accelerator Kick-downs|Total Effective Engine Speed Time|Total Cruise Control Time|Total Accelerator Kick-down Time|Total Brake Applications|Tachograph Driver 1 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 2 Card Number|Tachograph Driver 1 Name|Tachograph Driver 2 Name|Registration Number|Expansion Information|Rapid Brakings|Rapid Accelerations|Engine Torque|

menu2.name: CFU (CAN100 FOTA Upgrade)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTCFU is used to upgrade the firmware in CAN 100 over the air.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
0: CAN Module Firmware|1: CAN Module configuration |
0: Start Upgrade.|1: Cancel Upgrade.|

menu2.name: ACD (1-wire Device Settings)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTACD is used to configure the parameters of 1-wire devices which include an iButton/DR200, temperature sensors and humidity sensors.

menu3.RangeMx: Bit 0: Temperature data.|Bit 1: Humidity data.|

menu2.name: IEX (Input Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIEX is used to configure the parameters of external Bluetooth Input accessories. All these inputs are customizable. If the logic status is changed on one of Bluetooth Input accessories, the device will report the message +RESP:GTDIS to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Bluetooth Accessory Input Setting.|

menu2.name: OEX (Output Expansion)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTOEX is used to change the Bluetooth Output accessory status.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Bluetooth Output Accessory Setting.|
For output 7 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|For output 8 (not) to report +RESP:GTDOS|

menu2.name: UDT (User-defined Data Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUDT is used to transfer user-defined data to the destination specified by <Mode>. User-defined data is transferred in the +RESP:GTUDT message format.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable data transmission|2: Enable data transmission over Bluetooth|

Protocol Version, Firmware Version|Hardware Version|Unique ID|Device Name| Speed|Azimuth|Altitude|Cells information|Mileage, Reserved|HMC, Reserved|GSV|GEO State|Analog Input|Digital Input, Digital output, Motion Status|External Power VCC, Backup Battery Level, Charging|GEO Status Mask|PEO State|PEO Status Mask|Reserved|Send Time|

menu2.name: IDA (ID Authentication)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTIDA is used to protect against unauthorized use. This is achieved through an iButton reader for driver identification, and connecting an external relay to cut off the starter or the fuel pump

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Only authorized ID cards can unlock the vehicle.|2: Any ID card can unlock the vehicle.|
Report the ID which is authorized.|Report the ID which is unauthorized.|Report the ID which has logged out.|
0: IDA Number List|1: MAC List|

menu2.name: TMP (Temperature Alarm)
menu2.Description2: This command is used to set a temperature-alarm range for the terminal. According to the working mode, the terminal will report the event message TMP to the backend server when the temperature outside or inside the range is detected by the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable the Alarm within the temperature range|2: Enable the Alarm Outside the temperature range|3: Enable the Alarm within or outside the temperature range, But Report only once|
menu3.Description: 0: Disable temperature alarm.|1: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is within the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|2: Report temperature alarm if the current temperature is outside the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.|3: Report temperature alarm only once if the current temperature enters / exits the temperature range defined by <Low Temperature> and <High Temperature>.In this mode, <Send Interval> will be ignored. |

menu2.name: DAT (Transparent Data Transmission)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTDAT is used to transfer data between the backend server and an external device connected to the Bluetooth of the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Short Format|2: Long Format|4: Send data directly to the Bluetooth|5: Send data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF|
menu3.Description: 0: Send message to the backend server with +RESP:GTDAT (Short Format).|2: Send message to the backend server with +RESP:GTDAT (Long Format).|4: Send the pure data directly to the Bluetooth.|5: Send the pure data directly to the Bluetooth without CRLF.|

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Do not need the ACK report|1: Need the ACK report|

menu2.name: RTP (Remote File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTP is used to obtain files from the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Download File|
0: HTTP|
0: CA certificate.|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|

menu2.name: LTP (Local File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTLTP is used to write the file to the device by subcontracting.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Delete File|1:Write file|
0: CA certificate|1: Client Certificate|2: Client key|

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record configuration information from the configuration file (generated by Manage Tool) to be downloaded by the device during update via AT+GTUPC.

menu2.name: UPC (Over-the-air Configuration Update)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUPC command is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable.|
0: Disable|1: Enable|
0:UPC.|1:EUC |
Ignition Off|Ignition On|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the device or control the device when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS|1:RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL|2:READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM|3:REBOOT. Reboot the terminal|4:RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings|5:PWROFF. Power off the device|6:CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID|7:CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ|8:VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER|9: Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT|A:IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS|B: TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ|C:GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM|D: AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF|10:CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN|12:CVN. Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN|13:CSN. Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN|14:BLE. Commands for Bluetooth|1C:ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI|22:CAN Module Operation. Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module|25:SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS or clear the self-calibration status|31:DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports|3A:RLY. Set the state of the WRL300|

menu3.groupname: 0 - GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 1 - RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately via the message +RESP: GTRTL.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 2 - READ. Get the current configuration of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTALM.
menu3.Description: Check the AT Command can not exceed 20.

menu3.groupname: 4 - RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.
menu3.Description: Check the AT Command can not exceed 20.

menu3.groupname: 6 - CID. Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCID.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 7 - CSQ. Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTCSQ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 8 - VER. Get the version information of the device via the message +RESP:GTVER.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 9 - BAT. Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal via the message +RESP:GTBAT.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: A - IOS. Get status of all the IO ports via the message +RESP:GTIOS.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: B - TMZ. Get the time zone settings via the message +RESP:GTTMZ.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: C - GIR. Get cell information via the message +RESP:GTGSM.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: D - AIF. Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server via the message +RESP:GTAIF.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 10 - CAN. Get CAN information via the message +RESP:GTCAN

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 12 - CVN. Get the version number information of CAN Module via the message +RESP:GTCVN

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 13 - CSN. Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 1C - ATI. Get basic device information via the message +RESP:GTATI.
menu3.RangeMx: Firmware Version|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|BT Firmware Version|BT Boot Firmware Version|Reserved for SW|Reserved for SW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved for MCU|Reserved for MCU|Hardware Version|Reserved for HW|Reserved for HW|Reserved for HW|Reserved|Reserved|Reserved|Sensor ID|Modem IMEI|

0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 22 - CAN Module Operation. Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module.
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Read the current car model and report it via the message +RESP:GTCML.|1:Set car model. Please use the parameter <CAN100 Car Model ID> to set car model.|2:Start CAN chipset automatic synchronization.|

0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 25 - SCS. Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data via the message +RESP:GTSCS
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Read self-calibration status.|1:Clear self-calibration status.|

0: The message will be output to the backend server.|1: The message will be output to the main serial port.|3: If the command is received via SMS, the message will be output to the original SMS number; otherwise the message will be output to the backend server.|

menu3.groupname: 31 - DELBUF. Delete all the buffered reports.
3A - RLY. Set the state of the WRL300
menu3.RangeMx: 0:Disable relay of WRL300, switch the pin of the relay from NC to COM.|1:Enable relay of WRL300, switch the pin of the relay from NO to COM.|
